CSI API ETABS v1

cDatabaseTablesApplyEditedTables Method

Instructs the program to interactively import all of the tables stored in the table list using the SetTableForEditing... functions.

Namespace:  ETABSv1
Assembly:  ETABSv1 (in ETABSv1.dll) Version: 1.0.0.0 (2.3.0.0)

	ByRef NumErrorMsgs As Integer,
	ByRef NumWarnMsgs As Integer,
	ByRef NumInfoMsgs As Integer,

returnValue = instance.ApplyEditedTables(FillImportLog,
	NumFatalErrors, NumErrorMsgs, NumWarnMsgs,

int ApplyEditedTables(
	bool FillImportLog,
	int% NumFatalErrors,
	int% NumErrorMsgs,
	int% NumWarnMsgs,
	int% NumInfoMsgs,
	String^% ImportLog
)
abstract ApplyEditedTables :
        FillImportLog : bool *
        NumFatalErrors : int byref *
        NumErrorMsgs : int byref *
        NumWarnMsgs : int byref *
        NumInfoMsgs : int byref *
        ImportLog : string byref -> int

Parameters

FillImportLog
Type: SystemBoolean
Input Item: Whether the ImportLog string should be filled. Please note that the import log may be very large.
NumFatalErrors
Type: SystemInt32
Returned Item: The number of fatal errors that occurred during the import
NumErrorMsgs
Type: SystemInt32
Returned Item: The number of error messages logged during the import
NumWarnMsgs
Type: SystemInt32
Returned Item: The number of warning messages logged during the import
NumInfoMsgs
Type: SystemInt32
Returned Item: The number of informational messages logged during the import
ImportLog
Type: SystemString
Returned Item: A string containing all messages logged during the import

Return Value

Type: Int32
Returns 0 if the function executes correctly, otherwise returns nonzero
Remarks
If the model is locked at the time this command is called then only tables that can be interactively imported when the model is locked will be imported.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please save your model before calling this function. If a fatal error occurs, or this function returns nonzero, the model may be in a corrupted state and it is recommended that the user close the model without saving and reopen.
